result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan C Mollet was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Evan C Mollet was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Evan C Mollet is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Evan C Mollet was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Evan C Mollet was found guilty of Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all mandatory costs, fees, assessments (including the domestic abuse assessment) and surcharges due by 11-09-16 as to Count 2 and due by 11-09-17 as to Count 3 or the result is a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Any other sentence; with 211 days credit
Consecutive to: Any other sentence. Court ordered that after 6 months of this sentence is served, the Court will allow Huber for work

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Evan C Mollet in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Evan C Mollet in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 10 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 211 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory costs, fees, assessments (including the domestic abuse assessment), and surcharges by 11/09/2016 or the result is a civil judgment.

As to Count 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  Court ordered that after 6 months of this sentence is served, the Court will allow for Huber for work.
Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory costs, fees, assessments (including the domestic abuse assessment), and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) by 11/09/2017 or the result is a civil judgment.

Court advised the defendant regarding his right to vote. Court informed the defendant that is his not allowed to possession firearms or body armor.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial incarceration credit

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court, defendant Evan C Mollet not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for  Nick Heitman for the the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is requesting a brief adjournment of the sentencing to investigate new information.  State has no objection.  Case set for 11-9-2015 at 1:15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Received and filed with court.

At the hour of 04:42 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of NOT GUILTY, as to Count 1, Battery; GUILTY, as to Count 2, Disorderly Conduct; and GUILTY, as to Count 3, Violating a No Contact Order; which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3: Court granted state's motion for entry of judgment on the verdicts. No objection from Defense. Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. AS TO COUNT 1:  Defense enters a motion of acquittal. No objection from State. Court enters the motion of acquittal as to Count 1.

Defendant is a convicted felon. Firearms warning given. Voting admonishment given. DNA notification given.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Evan C Mollet in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Evan C Mollet in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Trial proceeded.  Opening statements by State and Defense.  Side bar.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  1).  Officer, Bernie Molthen (WAPD).  2). Victim, Lailing C.  Exhibits  1 - 8, and 10 - 13 offered, marked, and received into evidence.  Cross-Examination.  Redirect.  3).  Michael Otto (WAPD)  ReCross-Examination.  Redirect.  ReCross-Examination.  Redirect.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 02:34 pm. Discussions held outside the presence of the jury.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the Court. Jury in box at 02:49 pm.  Stipulation received, read, and filed with court.  Sworn for Defense:  1).  Defendant, Evan C. Mollet.  Cross-Examination. Redirect. ReCross-Examination. Jury out of box at 03:13 pm. Discussions held outside the presence of the jury. Defense moves for a mistrial denied by the Court.  Jury in box at 03:25 pm. Defense rest. State and Defense rest. Testimony closed. Court instructed jury. Closing arguments by State and Defense.  Court charged the jury.  Jury retired at the hour of 04:05 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Scott Krueger and Mark Spottek who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Defendant Evan C Mollet in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray and in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are prepared to proceed to trial.  In chambers discussion held.  Case re-called.  State's offer placed on the record and rejected.  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:47am.  
TWELVE good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense to be heard after lunch recess at 1:15pm.
Defendant's Motion in Limine.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court, defendant Evan C Mollet not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense rejects the offer of the State.  The offer of the State is now withdrawn. Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 10-12-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld
received and filed.   mld
received and filed.  mld
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 4.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court, Defendant Evan C Mollet not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Evan C Mollet in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Evan C Mollet in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for Nicolas Heitman for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.   Defense counsel was provided an offer letter by the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-27-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Evan C Mollet in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Upon the motion of the State, Court takes judicial notice of the certified documents (page 8-9), attached to the Criminal Complaint.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: West Allis Police Officer Michael Otto and West Allis Police Officer Bernie Molthen.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument herad and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Discovery provided to defense counsel.  Offer will be forwarded to defense counsel, per the State.  Case adjourned for Arraignment Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-14-2015 at 8:30 am.  mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lailing C

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain a DNA sample.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

Defendant Evan C Mollet in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Evan C Mollet in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Dallet.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Flanagan, Br. 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
